Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel !”
Reviews.Author: Koko481
Reviews.Content: It was really really bad. It was expensive, not well located. It was the last one available, so we didn't have a choice. It was dirty and there were no curtains at the windows were completly riped up! The shared bathrooms were DISGUSTING !! There were water leak from the celling. It smelled bad and the staff was very unfriendly. I wouldn't go back there ever !!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Osama53
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good from many points 1- The room is big enough ( room 309 ) 2- The heating is perfect in both room and bathroom 3- The breakfast is super by 3 stars scale 4- The transportation is so near M13 , S41 , S42 and U5 within 3 min walk from hotel station Frankfurter Allee 5- The Ring shopping center in near with Kaiser's , Lidle and Real supermarkets 6- A lot of fast food restaurants including Mac Donald's , Nordsee just less than 5 min walk from hotel The negative points 1- The wi-fi never work in hotel in our laptop or mobile 2- The girl in reception is not cooperate at all

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: nekorb
Reviews.Content: 1. the first night there was no hot shower till mid night. 2. the reception desk stuff was rude and impatient. 3. the water heater in the room is disgusting, old and dirty. i asked for replacement but they couldnt offer a new or cleaner one. very poor. 4. the lady at the reception desk on sunday morning was the worst hotel crew i have ever seen. She somehow misunderstood the other stranger having breakfast was with me and ordered me to pay for it upon checking out. Very rude and disrespectful. She didnt apologize for this neither. 5.noisy at night cause the traffic on the street next to the window is nonstopping. DONT GO TO THIS HOTEL UNLESS YOU DONT NEED ANY HELP FROM THE CREW.

Reviews.Title: “eldorado for train fans”
Reviews.Author: Kjelloslo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirt cheap and I had no great expectations.However I find it quite nice.The girls in the reception were sympathetic.Breakfast was OK.The trains didn't bother me although they drove by just outside the window. Typically East-Berlin neighborhood but not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “The railroad runs through the middle of the house”
Reviews.Author: scotty047
Reviews.Content: 12 trains an hour, day and night so i cannot recommend this hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Very good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lefteros
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice! I had read the reviews here and to be frank I expected worse. Concerning the noisy S-bahn, I'd like to say that we were put on the 2nd floor (that is in the same height as the S-bahn train), but our room was in the front side of the building, and so the noise was negligible. My guess is that rooms in the back of the building have some more amount of noise because the S-bahn line is behind the hotel. But my experience in a few words: no problem with the S-bahn. The rooms were very clean, and not small at all! The breakfast was very nice. Disadvantages for me: a) I'd prefer the room was a little bit more warm (wasn't cold but I come from a warmer country), b) The flow of water in the shower was a bit low. c) While the bed was double like we ordered, the mattress wasn't one double, but 2 singles!!! I stayed 5 nights at the hotel in room 209 and I got to say that it is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “On the Tracks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Orielpk
Reviews.Content: Only for railway fans. Stayed on first floor. Trains passing your window - room shakes - till late at night and then first thing in morning. Sleep almost impossible. Luckily staying only one night otherwise would have ended up a gibbering wreck. Complained and asked for reduction, Response was short and to the point - tough!. Not to be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “Really good!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay a lot. The trasport links were excellent, the area was good(near a good commercial centre)..It was easy to get to the centre and tha staff was really kind!Good also rooms and food..at a very convenient price!And then,Berlin is a wonderful city..

Reviews.Title: “Avoid 2nd floor rooms facing the railway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in a scruffy area of the city. My room was average but there wasn't a way of drawing the curtains at night so light came in early in the morning. My workmate was unlucky and had a room on the 2nd floor facing the railway so he couldn't sleep (floor trembling each time a train passed by, window at train level, etc). Breakfast was excellent!! with full range of fresh food, coffee, fruit, different types of bread... Staff was nice & helpful but they had some difficulties speaking english. They had a good restaurant service (food nicely cooked). It is close to the public transport.

Reviews.Title: “"Hostile" Reception and dificult to communicate in English.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms, breakfast, cleaning ness and location (“in a scruffy area”) were reasonable for the rates paid…But the reception was "Hostile" and difficult to communicate in English. The one (she) spoken English never smiled and made you feeling embarrassed whenever you asked for information; the other two, seamed to be polite but unable to communicate in English – I consider English as a tool to communicate in hotels with international clientele and nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: hatter08
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but the bathroom was a decent size. The area isnt the prettiest (east-side) but its very close to public transport and you can get everywhere quickly and easily. The best thing was the breakfast - fantastic! I would recommend it as a comfortable and quite central hotel. Perfect for a short stay to see Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “80s timewarp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel in East Berlin in a scruffy area but good transport links. Room was clean and fairly comfortable, a little on the small side. Decor throughout was dated. Breakfast was good and staff helpful. Overall good value for money if you're just looking for somewhere to sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Berlin Georghof & Hostel
HotelInfo.Address: Guertelstrasse 39, 41, 10247 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Friedrichshain)
